Name: Immortal Blaze
QuestDesc: You meet an old storyteller when you roam about in Hongzhen. While you listen to the the immortality tales about Mt. Firmament, you notice another interested listener...

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...The Weiqi pieces were scattered, but the guru remained calm. "It's getting late," he said gently to the woodcutter. "Shouldn't you be heading down the mountain?"

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As he glanced at the sky, the woodcutter was shocked to see how much time had passed. "It couldn't have been more than two hours," he thought in disbelief. Feeling apologetic, he prepared to leave, worried that the guru would be annoyed with him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But when the woodcutter turned around, he nearly jumped out of his skin. The hermit guru, who had been playing Weiqi and drinking wine, was now gone. In his place lay a shattered Weiqi board and a heap of decaying bones.

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The woodcutter was so scared that he dropped his bamboo basket and ran down the mountain without even looking back.

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As he reached the mountain's base, he was hit with a stark realization. The quaint village he remembered had bloomed into a bustling town, with sturdy brick houses replacing the humble thatched cottages. And where his home once stood, only an empty wasteland remained.

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He noticed a date on the calendar that he had never seen before. In shock, he grabbed a passerby and urgently asked, "Excuse me, can you tell me the current date and time?"

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As he heard the answer, his legs went weak. Everything had changed—time had passed and his loved ones were gone. No one remembered him anymore.

Dialogues.Speaker: Perplexed Audience
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So the woodcutter left Mt. Firmament, but how was he still alive and kicking? With a hundred year's worth of time inside him, shouldn't he...

Dialogues.Speaker: Onlookers
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your story... It's a bit far-fetched, don't you think? I mean, if I wasn't from Hongzhen, I might have fallen for it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Well! That's the whole point. The truth is stranger than fiction, my friend. Every detail in that story is based on real events.

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let me share with you the other legend of Mt. Firmament, for deep within its sacred peaks lies a powerful secret... the "Secret of Immortality"!

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We all know that Mt. Firmament is the abode of the Sentinel, gathering spiritual energies from both heaven and earth for countless eons. Over time, even the mountain itself has taken on the form of our majestic Sentinel!

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Living in the mountains for long stretches of time, surrounded by fresh air and drinking from nature's own bounty, can add years to one's life span!

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It all starts with that game of Weiqi, one that the woodcutter stumbled upon. Too bad those secrets have been long forgotten...

Dialogues.Speaker: Elder
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Gather around now, people. You're in for the story of a lifetime...

Options.PlotLineKey: …Changli?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Shh...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...I'll see you there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *yawn* What's with the ruckus... Huh, what’s that in your hands?

Options.PlotLineKey: Changli gave it to me a moment ago.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... "Behold Hongzhen in its entirety, next to a ring and hanging eaves. When eternal snow thaw into flowing streams, let us reconvene."

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ooh... I see, I see...

Options.PlotLineKey: Do you know what it means?
Ooh... So that's how it is...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see I've got no clue at all!

Options.PlotLineKey: So much for the anticipation!
Wow, I'm so shocked to hear that.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I get the very last part, at least! She’s asking you out! Well that's a fancy way to write stuff...

Options.PlotLineKey: ...The first part reads like it's about the meeting spot.
According to the description, it's somewhere in Hongzhen.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And now... this next sentence, "eternal snow thaw into streams"... What is that supposed to mean?

Options.PlotLineKey: Maybe it has something to do with local folklore.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How did you manage to get all that hidden meaning?

Options.PlotLineKey: I'm experienced. Dealt with Jinhsi's riddles already.
Thanks to my big brain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But the buildings in Hongzhen all look pretty much the same. Which one exactly was she talking about?

Options.PlotLineKey: We can ask around to find out. I’ve done this before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Makes sense. Lead the way!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In Hongzhen, an elderly storyteller shares the legend of a hidden Weiqi game on Mt. Firmament that is said to grant immortality. While listening, you notice Changli nearby. She hands you an accessory and a note before quietly leaving. The note hints at a secret meeting, and to decipher its meaning, you decide to ask around.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qihong
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What can I help you with?

Options.PlotLineKey: (Ask about the riddle in Changli’s note.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Qihong
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "When snow thaw into streams"? Ah, you’re not from around here, I bet? When we say that in Hongzhen, we mean the <ano=Time Period>Shichen</ano> of Wei. Early afternoon, the warmest hours of a day.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qihong
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Legend tells of a visitor who ventured here some centuries ago. Back then, local villagers were struggling with no firewood due to heavy snow. This visitor opened up a path with their Forte and diverted a hot spring to provide warmth and aid.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qihong
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: People say it was once a stunning sight, with mist and ice flowing westward down the streams, as if many celestial beings were returning to the sea. Now the sight has unfortunately disappeared, but the saying sticks. We use it to describe time in local speech.

Options.PlotLineKey: I see.
You're such a great storyteller, like everyone else I met here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qihong
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, it's what Grandpa Zou tells everyone. I haven't seen it with my own eyes, but when it comes to stories like this one... They're usually made-up.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qihong
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh please, I'm only repeating what I've heard from him. He's been on a roll with his stories lately. But let's not take them too seriously, they're just for entertainment.

Options.PlotLineKey: You don't believe in those stories?

Dialogues.Speaker: Qihong
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... Not that I don't want to believe them, but... Oh, you were listening to one of his stories earlier too, right? What did you think?

Options.PlotLineKey: It sounded interesting.
It was a bit too exaggerated.
I wasn't mentioned in the story, so a thumbs down.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qihong
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Really? So you're into stories and anecdotes too?

Dialogues.Speaker: Qihong
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Looks like we have that in common.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qihong
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha... Maybe Grandpa Zou can learn a thing or two from you in terms of humor.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qihong
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Grandpa Zou's great-grandfather was a descendant of the first inhabitants of Hongzhen. He grew up hearing stories about Mt. Firmament. Recently he heard Madam Magistrate had resolved the crisis, so he decided to visit and learn more about his roots.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qihong
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: People in town are curious about the outside world and how they are perceived. Grandpa Zou is happy to answer their questions and has unknowingly become popular among them. Before he knew it, everyone was coming to talk to him...

Options.PlotLineKey: And it turned into a storytelling session...
He must be a fan of that storyteller in Jinzhou.

Dialogues.Speaker: Qihong
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's funny to hear outsiders describe my hometown, Hongzhen, as mysterious. We're just a normal place with our own quirks...

Dialogues.Speaker: Qihong
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Especially lately, with so many people from Jinzhou coming on some kind of expedition. They're obsessed with us, like we're some kind of ancient relics. Can you believe they actually asked if our Pavo Plums have magical powers?

Dialogues.Speaker: Qihong
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Time truly is a formidable force...

Dialogues.Speaker: Suspicious Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What do you want? I've done nothing wrong!

Options.PlotLineKey: (Ask about the riddle in Changli's note.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Suspicious Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huh? Uh... You're just asking for directions...? Sorry, I'm not a local, can't help you there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Suspicious Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait, you... you were the one talking to Lady Changli earlier, weren't you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The young man begins looking around warily, as if in fear of something terrible hidden in the shadows.

Dialogues.Speaker: Suspicious Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If I were you, I'd steer clear of her. She's a deceitful woman who enjoys toying with people's hearts. A cunning villain who will manipulate you without you even knowing it.

Options.PlotLineKey: How so?

Dialogues.Speaker: Suspicious Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haven't you heard? She left her government job to come here, to this small town. There's gotta be a reason behind it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Suspicious Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I heard she chose to quit her job, but I bet she messed up back in the capital and got demoted here as punishment.

Options.PlotLineKey: ...It's not nice to badmouth people like this.
Not everyone values power and fame.

Dialogues.Speaker: Suspicious Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then I guess you've also been fooled by her looks. That woman will stop at nothing to get what she wants, while you remain oblivious to her true intentions. And by the time you catch on, you'll already be caught in her trap.

Dialogues.Speaker: Suspicious Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait a minute, has she actually achieved anything substantial during her time in Jinzhou? Or did Madam Magistrate just fall for her clever words and let her slack off?

Options.PlotLineKey: You're underestimating Jinhsi.
What makes you so sure?

Dialogues.Speaker: Suspicious Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmph... I say you're underestimating Changli's trickery.

Dialogues.Speaker: Suspicious Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I... I have my reasons to believe so!

Dialogues.Speaker: Suspicious Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I heard she tricked that VIP guest of Jinzhou into going to Mt. Firmament. Just think about how dangerous that place was!

Dialogues.Speaker: Suspicious Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She must have been afraid of {Male=him;Female=her} getting too close to Madam Magistrate and ruining her plans... What a sinister woman! Fortunately, that guest was a skilled fighter, and {Male=he;Female=she} managed to escape unharmed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Suspicious Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I hope you don't mind my frankness. Just giving some advice, 'cause you look pretty innocent and gullible... Not from Jinzhou judging by your outfit, right?

Options.PlotLineKey: I am that VIP guest.
People call me Rover.

Dialogues.Speaker: Suspicious Young Man
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh shoot, I completely forgot about something I need to do. Sorry, gotta run...

Dialogues.Speaker: Youning
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Uhh... How did she disappear like that? Wait, are you that legendary Rover who saved Jinzhou?!

Dialogues.Speaker: Youning
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahem... what can I do for you?

Options.PlotLineKey: (Ask about the riddle in Changli's note.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Youning
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, you've come to the right person! I'm here to compile a new travel guide for Hongzhen!

Dialogues.Speaker: Youning
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: "Next to a ring and hanging eaves"... Oh! I know where that is. You'll need to stand on the tallest building in Hongzhen to see what you're looking for.

Options.PlotLineKey: The tallest building?

Dialogues.Speaker: Youning
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's on the northeast side of the town, can't miss it. You'll see it once you get there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Youning
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Say, that person earlier... that was Lady Changli, right?! I saw you talking to her!

Options.PlotLineKey: Yes.
Do you know her?

Dialogues.Speaker: Youning
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can't help but feel envious. I wish I could speak to her like you did, but she refuses to do interviews with the Pioneer Association. Plus, I doubt we have anything in common to talk about anyway.

Dialogues.Speaker: Youning
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course! Everyone in Jinzhou knows about Lady Changli, even though she rarely appears in public.

Dialogues.Speaker: Youning
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As Master Xuanmiao's disciple, she excels in the arts of politics and diplomacy. Her travels have taken her across the four seas, and as Secretary-General, she has commanded respect from all who cross her path!

Options.PlotLineKey: Really?

Dialogues.Speaker: Youning
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yeah! And she came all the way to Jinzhou to help out Magistrate Jinhsi for the sake of peace in Huanglong. She's been working tirelessly behind the scenes since then, fully dedicated to her task...

Dialogues.Speaker: Youning
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How could anyone not revere such a selfless act?

Dialogues.Speaker: Youning
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *sigh* I could've sworn I just saw her. Where did she go? I wish I could take one more look...

Options.PlotLineKey: Are you sure you're just here for the travel guide?

Dialogues.Speaker: Youning
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ahaha...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hey. Why are the people here so divided about Changli?

Options.PlotLineKey: She doesn't seem to have ill intents.
We'll have to figure it out ourselves.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... You humans make everything so complicated.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well, at least now we know what she wanted to say.

Options.PlotLineKey: "Let’s meet at the highest place in Hongzhen, in the early afternoon."

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now that’s much easier to understand. Why did she have to make it a whole riddle? *yawn*... I’m getting sleepy again.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover?

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nice to see you again. How are you liking Hongzhen so far?

Options.PlotLineKey: It's nice. The place is bustling with life.
It's much more lively than before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The crisis at Mt. Firmament has been resolved, and the waterway between Jinzhou and Hongzhen is open once again. As a result, there has been an increase in visitors from Jinzhou, making the town more lively than before.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: With the chaos subsiding, our town and city are now reconnected, allowing residents to live and work in peace.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We owe you a debt of gratitude, Rover, for your efforts in clearing the remaining effects of Temporal Disruptions in Mt. Firmament over the past few days.

Options.PlotLineKey: Just doing my part.
Couldn't have done it without everyone.
That job was a beast. You better have my money ready.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *chuckle* Of course.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're all indebted to you, Hongzhen and its people alike. If there's anything you need, don't hesitate to ask.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I couldn't help but notice you've been asking around. Is there something you need assistance with?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Xinyi and Changli have a mutual trust as acquaintances. It should be fine to ask Xinyi instead...)

Options.PlotLineKey: Well...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You tell Xinyi about your encounter with Changli and what the passersby said about her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... I see. That sounds like something Changli would do.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Even though we're not that close, I know a bit about her personality. She wouldn't just hand over something that symbolizes her identity to anyone, especially when...

Options.PlotLineKey: Especially what?

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I think it would be better for her to tell you personally.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Magistrate's Counselor is shrouded in mystery, and her motives are often hard to decipher...

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When she wants something done, it's never as straightforward as it seems, and few can grasp the true meaning behind her plans.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The rumors and controversies surrounding her never cease, but she seems unfazed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: However... I believe one has to get involved personally to truly understand Changli's intentions, regardless of public opinion.

Options.PlotLineKey: My plans exactly.
I'm very curious about her plans.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: About the riddle... it seems you have already figured it out by yourself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But remember, it's not just about the answer, but also what she wants you to understand.

Options.PlotLineKey: Indeed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *chuckle* Then... If you'll excuse me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If there's anything else you need here in Hongzhen, please do not hesitate to let me know.

Options.PlotLineKey: Thank you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The people you speak with have varying opinions on Changli, but you deduce the meeting location from their insights. You encounter Xinyi, who identifies the accessory as one of Changli's prized possessions, suggesting that understanding her intentions will require personal involvement.

Chapters.Title: Find the place "Next to a Ring and Hanging Eaves"

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (A ring, she wrote... Should be this ring-shaped ancient structure, I guess?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wow, it’s really huge now that we look at it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Next, hanging eaves... If we look from here... Is it that pavilion?

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It does look quiet. Should be a nice place for meetings... *yawn* Ugh, getting 'eepy again…

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That must be the place, then.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I’ll get going.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Apologies for my delay.

Options.PlotLineKey: It's fine. I just got here too.
Something tells me you've been here for a while.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you for accepting my invitation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You looked adorable, focusing on the Weiqi board. I didn't want to interrupt you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you for accepting my invitation.

Options.PlotLineKey: I see you really love your riddles.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh? And what makes you think so?

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Those tokens from Jinhsi... It was your idea, was it not?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *chuckle*...So you've guessed it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry, {PlayerName}. Jinzhou faced multiple threats back then, and we had to be cautious. We did not intend to inconvenience you. I regret our lack of hospitality.

Options.PlotLineKey: It's okay. Jinhsi had explained your reasons.
I'm more or less used to it by now...
It's a thing of the past.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Still, I owe you an apology in person.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This time... *chuckle* I just wanted to see you. The brilliant mind that always understood my unspoken words.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...I am very grateful you decided to come.

Options.PlotLineKey: What's the deal this time? Another Tacet Discord to beat?
What's the deal this time? Another errand to run?
Let's cut to the chase. What do you want from me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Apologies for giving you that impression, Rover. That’s not how we treat our saviors.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Apologies for giving you that impression, Rover. That’s not how we treat our saviors.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I merely have a few questions, and I was wondering if you may have the answers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Does this game of <ano=Go>Weiqi</ano> look familiar to you, Rover?

Options.PlotLineKey: No.
...I'm not sure.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...I see.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Apologies. I heard about your memory loss. Please pardon me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There is a local tale about the "Secret of Immortality" being hidden on Mt. Firmament. Have you heard about it?

Options.PlotLineKey: The one I heard in Hongzhen?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. I have a slightly different version of this tale to share.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Centuries ago, a Taoist cultivator met an enigmatic visitor on Mt. Firmament. Despite their age difference, they soon became friends and often played Weiqi together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: One day, a woodcutter stumbled upon them, having lost his way home. Their game mesmerized him so much that he didn't notice the red tie on his basket rotting away… Panicked, he bumped into the Weiqi board.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Despite the interruption, the visitor remained unfazed. They offered the woodcutter some tea, then guided him down the mountain, shielding him from dangerous Temporal Disruptions. After that, the visitor disappeared.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Many years later, the Taoist cultivator became a legendary hermit guru. Upon returning to Mt. Firmament in his final years, he reunited with that elusive visitor.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The two resumed their unfinished game. People believe the visitor shared their Secret of Immortality through cleverly-placed Weiqi pieces, as a final parting gift.

Options.PlotLineKey: You mean this game in front of us?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes... and no. This game is missing the final twenty moves. It is unfinished.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That was a bit different from what you heard before, I guess? The story changed over time, infused with fantasy in each retelling.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But that's how old tales go, slowly losing their truth as they're passed down.

Options.PlotLineKey: You mean the other folklores may hold some truth too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Precisely.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The legend may be shrouded in myth, but that game of Weiqi was real. Embedded within its records lies a cryptic message: "This game record can solve the crisis of time."

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: From what I know, only the Sentinel in its prime has the power to manipulate time through its possession of a complete Temporal Mandate. For us mere mortals, controlling time is indeed similar to gaining immortality.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As the records state, it only reveals itself when Mt. Firmament emerges. But how it ties to the Temporal Mandate remains an enigma... at least for now.

Options.PlotLineKey: The Sentinel's wounds...
There might be an undamaged sample of Temporal Mandate.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. We may find a way to heal them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If that is the case, we’ll be able to heal the Sentinel's wounds.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... our chances are looking slim. That game record could just hold my teacher's memories, not any real value.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So I am presenting this as merely a personal request.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I am planning to go find that record. Could you please join me?

Options.PlotLineKey: Sure.
Why me?
I’ll consider it, but what's in it for me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you for lending me a hand. I promise it will be worth your while.

Options.PlotLineKey: I am interested in this tale too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As we have been to Mt. Firmament before, I imagined it would pique your interest, as the tale concerns our Sentinel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And, moreover... You are special to me, and… to Mt. Firmament. I hope I have provided enough reasons to clear your doubts.

Options.PlotLineKey: Special?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I asked you about the unfinished Weiqi game, because I believe it may have something to do with your past.

Options.PlotLineKey: You mean...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes… After all, it takes two to play Weiqi, right?

Options.PlotLineKey: I see. Then I suppose I have no reason to not go.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If my speculation is correct… That game of Weiqi may hold clues to your lost memories.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: In addition… I promise to aid you in any way I can after we return with the record. How does that sound?

Options.PlotLineKey: I see. Then I have no reason to not go.
Alright. Count me in!

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Splendid.

Options.PlotLineKey: It's still early. How about we set off now?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Very well. Let's meet on the gallery road outside Hongzhen.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I still have some preparations to do. Please go ahead, I'll join you later.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At the pavilion mentioned in the note, you meet Changli. She shares the full story behind the "unfinished Weiqi game"—an enigmatic visitor once hid the Secret of Immortality in the last Weiqi game she played with her master. This game might be tied to the Temporal Mandate and your lost memory. Changli asks for your help in uncovering the truth.

Chapters.Title: Head to the designated location to see Changli

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover, you're here.

Options.PlotLineKey: Wasn't expecting you to arrive before me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well... As the Wayfinder, I do know a couple shortcuts.

Options.PlotLineKey: I trust you’ll guide me well, Miss Wayfinder.
Where are we going?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The notes only provided a vague idea of where the game record is. I've determined the most likely location on my last visit.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We’ll be heading there. See if we can find anything new.

Options.PlotLineKey: You've been there before?
That’s surprisingly straightforward, especially coming from you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After dealing with those Artificers, I ruled out the other locations on my way to join you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But one can only do so much alone. This is why I need your help.

Options.PlotLineKey: Lucky for you, I'm very good at finding things.
Gotta throw myself a challenge from time to time.
I'm not planning to go back on my own words.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: How reliable.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then let's get going.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You meet Changli again and she shares that she has pinpointed the most likely location of the game record. Together, you prepare to search for it.

Chapters.Title: Head into Mt. Firmament with Changli

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Changli? What is it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nothing, {PlayerName}. I just thought... the snow is beautiful today.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You seem curious about that ancient structure.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It looks familiar... Like the abandoned Court of Savantae facility I saw, but bigger in scale.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I heard it first appeared along with our Sentinel. Later, the Court of Savantae based their Chronosorters on its design.

Chapters.Title: Head into Mt. Firmament with Changli
Head into Mt. Firmament with Changli

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Every winter, my hometown buzzed as people left their mark in the fresh snow, hoping for dreams to come true when it melted.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did you try it too, Changli?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, I only watched from afar... My Forte always melted the snow faster than I liked.

Chapters.Title: Head into Mt. Firmament with Changli

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We can see the whole of Hongzhen from here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I never noticed how beautiful it looked during my previous visits.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's the same place as always. I suppose it's my state of mind that has changed.

Options.PlotLineKey: How did it change?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I don't know. Maybe it's because... Your presence makes me feel at ease.

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wait... I smell Tacet Discords in that cave!

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No... There's more... Tacet Discords, humans, and...

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Smells like a whole bunch of messed up frequencies... It's so... familiar...

Options.PlotLineKey: (How could there be any Tacet Discords in Mt. Firmament?)
(Is Abby sleep talking again?)

Dialogues.Speaker: Abby
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: C’mon, after all we've been through, you still don't trust my sniffer? Be grateful, I'm giving you a warning!

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Rover? Did something happen?

Options.PlotLineKey: Tacet Discords could be assaulting people over there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's in the same direction we’re going. Could it be...

Options.PlotLineKey: Let's go take a look.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: As you and Changli enjoy the view from the pavilion in Hongzhen, Abby senses the mixed frequencies of Tacet Discords and humans from a cave. Someone may be in danger...

Chapters.Title: Find the source of the smell Abby mentioned

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Signs of climbing... Someone may have been here before us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Explorer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Get away... from me! Ugh... I can't hold up much longer...

Chapters.Title: Defeat the TDs and rescue the explorer

Dialogues.Speaker: Explorer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Help, help! Oh, thank goodness...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please stand back. We'll take it from here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Explorer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I-I can fight! Let me help!

Dialogues.Speaker: Explorer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: T-Thanks for your help...

Options.PlotLineKey: Are you all right?

Dialogues.Speaker: Explorer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I... I'm okay. Wait, you... Are you THE Rover...?

Options.PlotLineKey: How do you know me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Explorer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You're that hero who fought against the Threnodian, and you also resolved the time crisis here with Madam Magistrate. Everyone's been talking about you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Explorer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And Lady Changli... I-I never thought I'd have the chance to see you in person...

Dialogues.Speaker: Explorer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Without your help, I would've been a goner for sure...

Dialogues.Speaker: Explorer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I can't die here. Not when I've got someone waiting for me...

Dialogues.Speaker: Explorer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've finally, finally found it... After all this time... Ugh...

Options.PlotLineKey: Take it easy. Everything's all right.
Relax. Your wounds look pretty bad.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: While we've solved the crisis in Mt. Firmament for the time being... Public access to the mountain is still restricted. Before entering the mountain, any explorer must submit a request and can only do so while accompanied by the Midnight Rangers.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sir, could you please share your reasons for traveling here alone?

Dialogues.Speaker: Explorer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I, I heard about Mt. Firmament's legend... So I came to find its secret...

Dialogues.Speaker: Explorer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've only been in the mountain for half a day, everything was going smoothly before those monsters pounced on me on my way back... *cough*...

Dialogues.Speaker: Explorer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I must get back... Fuling... She's still waiting for me...

Options.PlotLineKey: He doesn't look like he's only been here for half a day...
He seems a bit off.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It seems he is still hiding something from us.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Some of those injuries are older than half a day...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He needs to go back to Hongzhen for proper medical attention... Time is against us.

Options.PlotLineKey: We’ll need to escort him down the mountain.
Something feels strange about this place.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Agreed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The appearance of Tacet Discords is indeed unusual… We can ask him later when he's recovered a bit more.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Indeed. Tacet Discords appearing in such numbers on Mt. Firmament, of all places… This is unusual, to say the least.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We can continue our conversation later, after getting him to safety.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: On that note, we still don't know his identity... Judging from this uniform, he might be affiliated with the Pioneer Association.

Options.PlotLineKey: The Association has a presence in Hongzhen right now.
He mentioned someone waiting for him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then perhaps that "someone" is in Hongzhen. Could be his friend or an acquaintance.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Good point, Rover. Let's head back.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You take the adventurer in coma and return to Hongzhen with Changli

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You rush to rescue an adventurer under attack by Tacet Discords. The adventurer, claiming to seek Mt. Firmament's secrets, faints. Changli suspects he is hiding something and plans to gather more information once you return to Hongzhen.

Dialogues.Speaker: Hongzhen Resident
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Isn't that Wuli? What happened to him?

Options.PlotLineKey: Do you know him?

Dialogues.Speaker: Hongzhen Resident
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Not really... He showed up in town and started asking weird questions to all the older folks. They've been avoiding him ever since.

Dialogues.Speaker: Explorer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Secret of Immortality... I've found it...

Dialogues.Speaker: Hongzhen Resident
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *sigh* He really went up the mountain, didn't he? Oh my... Quick, get him to a doctor!

Dialogues.Speaker: Explorer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No... I'm fine... Go find Fuling...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sir, do you know where his companions might be?

Dialogues.Speaker: Hongzhen Resident
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm not sure. There are lots of other people in town who are dressed just like him. Why don't you try asking them?

Options.PlotLineKey: We will. Thanks for the tips.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pioneer Association Photographer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: His companions? Hmm... Sorry, I just joined the Association not long ago. I don't really know them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pioneer Association Photographer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: His gear though, these are last year's designs... Perhaps you should go ask Youning? She's been a member for quite some time. She might know him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Pioneer Association Photographer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Youning's just up ahead.

Dialogues.Speaker: Youning
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Woah...! G-Greetings, Lady Changli!

Dialogues.Speaker: Youning
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: H-How may I help you today, Lady Changli? Oh and, hello {PlayerName}! The person on your back... Is he okay?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We found him on Mt. Firmament. Do you know where his companions might be?

Dialogues.Speaker: Youning
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Isn't this Wuli? What happened to him?

Options.PlotLineKey: He was attacked by Tacet Discords.
He's still unconscious...

Dialogues.Speaker: Youning
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He's one of the Pioneer Association's explorers, but we don't see him around Jinzhou too often.

Dialogues.Speaker: Youning
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I remember he went on sabbatical months ago, and he left with Fuling...

Options.PlotLineKey: Fuling?

Dialogues.Speaker: Youning
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, Fuling, his girlfriend. I think they're visiting Hongzhen together. They're staying at the inn over there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Youning
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh, Fuling asked us about his whereabouts not long ago. She seemed quite worried.

Dialogues.Speaker: Youning
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Speaking of... Is he really okay? Perhaps we should get him to a hospital first...

Dialogues.Speaker: Wuli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No, I'm not going... Fuling... She's waiting for me...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry. We'll help you find Fuling.

Chapters.Title: Go to the hotel where Fuling is staying

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Woman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: W-Wuli! I.. *cough*...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Breathe. Take it easy.

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Woman
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *cough*... Thank you. I'm okay now. Who are you? ... And Wuli, is he...

Options.PlotLineKey: You must be Fuling?

Dialogues.Speaker: Fuling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes, I am... Can you please tell me what happened?

Dialogues.Speaker: Wuli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fuling...!

Dialogues.Speaker: Fuling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wuli... You're hurt?! I've been looking for you... You didn't pick up my calls...

Dialogues.Speaker: Wuli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Great news, Fuling! ...I found it! Finally!

Dialogues.Speaker: Wuli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've found a way to slow down your illness. No more pain, my love... We can finally be together, forever!

Dialogues.Speaker: Fuling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You mean... that legend? It's real?

Dialogues.Speaker: Wuli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fuling... Are you... Are you not happy?

Dialogues.Speaker: Fuling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No... I am... I'm so glad to hear it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Wuli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha... Yes...

Dialogues.Speaker: Fuling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Wuli!

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You carry an exhausted and unconscious Wuli to a doctor to treat his injuries.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fuling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you, {PlayerName}, Lady Changli. You saved his life...

Options.PlotLineKey: I'm glad he's okay.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fuling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: May I please ask... what on earth happened? I've never seen Wuli like that...

Options.PlotLineKey: Well...
... And then we found you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fuling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So... He said he only spent half a day in the mountains?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Was that not the case?

Dialogues.Speaker: Fuling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No... I've been... I've been waiting for almost a week.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fuling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's not unusual for Wuli to be out of touch for a few days when he goes on long trips. This time, however, seemed longer than usual. If it weren't for you two showing up, I would have asked the Midnight Rangers to help me search for him in the mountains.

Options.PlotLineKey: What's his obsession with the mountains?

Dialogues.Speaker: Fuling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Wuli, he... He did it for me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fuling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I used to work as a landscape painter. Wuli and I met through work, and we traveled to many places together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fuling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A few months ago, I got really sick. It affected my ability to walk, which got worse over time. We couldn't go on our adventures like we used to. Wuli stopped taking on work and traveled all over the world to find a cure for me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fuling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Despite his efforts, we couldn't find any cures... Until two weeks ago, when he brought me to Hongzhen. Said he had a surprise for me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fuling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I thought it was just going to be a relaxing trip, but he disappeared for seven days. Now he's back, rambling about having found a way to stop my condition from progressing...

Options.PlotLineKey: He was saying something about the "legend"...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mt. Firmament's "Secret of Immortality", I presume?

Dialogues.Speaker: Fuling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes... Wuli told me that he's researched and found an untouched paradise on Mt. Firmament. A place where time stands still. He said if I lived there, my condition would never worsen...

Dialogues.Speaker: Fuling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...It cannot fully cure me, but at least we can spend eternity together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fuling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At first, I thought it was just a myth... But then you brought up how he only spent half a day in the mountains...

Options.PlotLineKey: He may have run into Temporal Disruptions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fuling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Those were my thoughts as well, but Wuli seemed very certain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Mt. Firmament used to have Temporal Disruptions caused by its tumultuous history. However, thanks to Magistrate Jinhsi and Rover, these disruptions have been dealt with. Or so we had hoped.

Options.PlotLineKey: Looks like there might still be some of them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So there are still unaddressed Temporal Disruptions in the mountains. And unfortunately, Wuli has stumbled upon one, mistaking it for the legendary cure he was searching for.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But little did he know, it would only put him in more danger.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fuling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see...

Dialogues.Speaker: Fuling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...So that's why there were rumors of Rangers being here to take care of the leftover Tacet Discords, and block off access to the mountain...

Dialogues.Speaker: Fuling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Then... if this Temporal Disruption you speak of is truly so dangerous...

Dialogues.Speaker: Fuling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, Lady Changli, please help us get rid of it. For the sake of everyone here.

Options.PlotLineKey: But your friend...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He truly thinks it's the only way to save you. He's willing to take a slim chance, just for you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fuling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Freezing my own time... I don't think I should do that. It's not my best option. I appreciate your concerns, but I'll be fine.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fuling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Dreams always come to an end. Eventually we have to wake up, and keep moving forward.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fuling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *cough* I... I'm okay. I haven't talked this much in a long time.

Options.PlotLineKey: I'll go get a doctor for you.
You need to rest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fuling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...I'm just a little tired. I'll be fine after some rest.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fuling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Once Wuli wakes up, I'll explain everything to him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you have any other ideas, just tell him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But if you keep it all to yourself... No one, even those closest to you, will know how you really feel.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fuling
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Yes. I understand.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, things are taking a turn. We should probably tell Lady Xinyi first.

Options.PlotLineKey: Indeed. Let's go.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: At the hotel, you meet Fuling, the gravely ill girlfriend of the adventurer Wuli. He had gone into the mountains seeking a way to slow her condition but mistakenly believed that the Temporal Disruptions held the key to immortality. Accepting her fate, Fuling pleads with you to put a stop to the dangerous Disruptions.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What brings you here at this time of the day?

Options.PlotLineKey: There's been a bit of an incident.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_undefined
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You explain the events that have transpired.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I see. Strange appearances of Tacet Discords in the mountains, and undiscovered Temporal Disruptions...

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There are several questionable details according to {PlayerName}'s description.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What do you make of Fuling's words from earlier, Rover?

Options.PlotLineKey: About what happened to Wuli...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He claimed to have spent only half a day in the mountains, but it's been seven days since he returned to Hongzhen... That does sound like some kind of Temporal Disruption, one that wasn't strong enough to affect Hongzhen.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: After Jinhsi's battle with the Sentinel, she ordered Midnight Rangers to patrol Hongzhen and inspect Mt. Firmament for any lingering Temporal Disruptions before reopening it to the public.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: {PlayerName}, you've been exploring the mountains lately, so I'm sure you have a good grasp on Mt. Firmament. But if there are any hidden disruptions we missed...

Options.PlotLineKey: It must've appeared after Wuli entered the mountains.
Someone had kept it hidden.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Precisely. Yet... Why did it reappear at this point?

Options.PlotLineKey: Maybe it has something to do with Wuli.
Maybe it needed a specific trigger.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fuling's "legend" differs from the situation at Mt. Firmament we're familiar with. In that tale, mortals were spared the cost of losing years from their lives.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: He was utterly convinced of his discovery, and he somehow managed to run into Temporal Disruptions in half a day’s time. Also… when I questioned him, he evaded my inquiries.

Options.PlotLineKey: Was he lying?
He was hiding something.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Lies that are most challenging to detect aren't usually outright falsehoods, rather they hide parts of the truth.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The explorer wanted to save his friend indeed, but he was also hiding something.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...I've become rather curious about the truth behind this "Temporal Disruption."

Options.PlotLineKey: About Fuling's attitude towards all of this...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Did you notice something, {PlayerName}?

Options.PlotLineKey: She accepted the reality a little too quickly.
Why did she want to get rid of the Temporal Disruption?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: For someone with a terminal illness, they should hold onto any chance of survival—no matter how slim... Is that what you think?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Maybe she's come to terms with her destiny, or maybe... she never planned on continuing to live like that forever.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Changli...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Well, please pardon my baseless speculations.

Options.PlotLineKey: About the anomalies in that area...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I knew you'd notice too.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The frequency disturbance here is weak. It's similar to past Temporal Disruptions at Mt. Firmament, but not exactly the same.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Master Xuanmiao's records show that this is where the game record last appeared. This is also where we found that explorer.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ... As Changli mentioned, this anomaly may indeed have something to do with that legendary game record.

Options.PlotLineKey: The complete Temporal Program indicated in that game record...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Exactly... If this were to be the case, then we are not the only ones searching for its whereabouts.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The explorer did not tell us about his source of information.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But his knowledge of Mt. Firmament far exceeds that of a first-time visitor.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You mean...

Options.PlotLineKey: Something bigger is behind all of this.
We need more information. Let's not act rashly.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Got it. The Midnight Rangers will block all entrances to the mountain for now. And Changli, you still have the power to send in garrison troops as needed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We left Mt. Firmament in a hurry. I need to go back up the mountain and investigate further... I have some theories that could use confirmation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We're still unsure about the exact location and range of the Temporal Disruption. Regardless, its reappearance is a pressing issue that needs our attention.

Options.PlotLineKey: I'm coming with you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It may get dangerous.

Options.PlotLineKey: I haven't fulfilled my promise yet.
Then having another person onboard makes it less dangerous.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well then... Thank you, {PlayerName}.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you again for your help. You were supposed to be here for a relaxing time... but it seems another crisis has popped up.

Dialogues.Speaker: Xinyi
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do take extra caution.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Through discussions with Xinyi, you begin to question Wuli's motives and his sources of information. You suspect that the Temporal Disruption might be part of a larger scheme and could be connected to the Weiqi record you are searching for.

Chapters.Title: Return to the cave where you met Wuli

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now it has become quite clear what the two were thinking.

Options.PlotLineKey: So this is what she had on her mind...
Did you know about it all along?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I had my speculation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Fuling has come to terms with her impending death. She doesn't buy into the legends of "immortality." Instead, she simply wants to make the most of the time she has left and fulfill her and Wuli's dreams together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If Wuli wants to reach that so-called "paradise," he'll be trapped inside forever. It also means he'll have to give up his entire future as an explorer.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: That is not what she wants for him.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Her ultimate desire is for her lover to embrace her inevitable passing, and to realize the joint aspirations they hold in her place.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She hasn't given up, but rather clings to hope for their future, even if she won't be there to see it unfold.

Options.PlotLineKey: Would you make the same choice... If it had happened to you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm...? Why the sudden question?

Options.PlotLineKey: It seems you don't care that much about your own death.
You seem to understand Fuling deeply.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that how you see me? Hmm... Perhaps for some, death is just a destination. There are more significant things to focus on.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm just making an educated guess from what we've collected. And honestly, Fuling isn't exactly good at keeping things to herself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's stay focused on the issue. While the diary is cryptic, it still exposes the true intentions of whoever misled Wuli.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's no coincidence. All the clues point to a correlation between the Temporal Disruption and the legends of the Weiqi game. Or maybe... someone's trying to make us connect the dots.

Options.PlotLineKey: Wuli's diary mentioned the Sentinel.
Since the Fractsidus already know so much about the Sentinel...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. Information on the actual powers of Jué... This isn't the kind of information an ordinary explorer can obtain.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I guess our "old friends" have still not given up.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They went to great lengths just to lead us here. It would be rather rude of us to not respond in some way.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: According to the information in my master's notes, and Wuli's map...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...The place we're looking for should be just ahead.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: While investigating Wuli's camp, you learn that Fuling has accepted her fate and doesn't want Wuli to sacrifice his future as an adventurer for her. Wuli's diary reveals ties to the Fractsidus, suggesting someone is trying to connect the Temporal Disruption to the Weiqi game.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is that...

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The chaotic Temporal Disruptions are even clearer to see.

Chapters.Title: Go to the area where time flows in disorder

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Traces of excavation on the ground... Looks like someone was trying to dig a hole with their bare hands. Could it be Wuli?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is... a Weiqi board.

Options.PlotLineKey: Could it have anything to do with the game record?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The abnormal time flow here is most likely caused by the Chronosorters. Perhaps there is a way to fix it.

Chapters.Title: Learn about the Weiqi Board's past

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Man's Mirage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Marvelous play, truly remarkable. Occupying both solid territory and influence. An extraordinary move.

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Man's Mirage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Never have I imagined I'd experience such a great game of Weiqi on Mt. Firmament. You may look young, my friend, but there's so much more to you than meets the eye.

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Man's Mirage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please, no need to be so modest. I can tell the difference between our skill levels.

Options.PlotLineKey: A mirage of the past...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...This is my master's voice. The voice of the other person seems deliberately erased.

Options.PlotLineKey: Master Xuanmiao?

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Who do you think the other person looks like?

Options.PlotLineKey: That person looks familiar.
That person looks like... me?
Is this why you brought me here?

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Changli seems to be in deep thought and does not answer.

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Man's Mirage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It has been decades since we last met, but you, my friend, still look the same.

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Man's Mirage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Turns out I had already met you all those years ago, my life saver… and you're older than me. I should have been more respectful back then.

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Man's Mirage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So you remember our promise. I am overjoyed...

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Man's Mirage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A new city is about to be established. Having accomplished so much, why do you choose to retire now?

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Man's Mirage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...I may have spoken out of turn. If you're not in a rush to depart Jinzhou, how about another round of Weiqi with me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Man's Mirage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *cough*... Well played. Even after twenty years, I still have no chance of winning against you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Man's Mirage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Haha... I barely noticed how so much time has passed.

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Man's Mirage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Every move in Weiqi is fluid and unpredictable. Even if we start with the same opening, the outcome can never be predetermined... We see this in our game, and it's true for all the lives out there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Man's Mirage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My clan are a group of hermits. We view the world as a game of strategy, manipulating the ebb and flow behind the scenes...

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Man's Mirage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But you, my friend, chose to enter the game yourself. It's a dangerous path with no end in sight. I want to help, but my time is running out. I won't be there when you finally succeed...

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Man's Mirage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please don't feel sad for me. If I die, it would be an honor to rest at the Sentinel's feet.

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Man's Mirage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When the time comes... the one who shall finish this game of Weiqi with you will not be me, but rather my apprentice.

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Man's Mirage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do my plans seem too risky to you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Man's Mirage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: No need for concern. With her intelligence and quick thinking, she'll surely be able to solve this puzzle.

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Man's Mirage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The result of this game will decide the fate of Jinzhou, and even the entire world.

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Man's Mirage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The road ahead is long and treacherous... Our final game, let's make it...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You've come this far and followed us here, yet you hesitate to reveal yourselves. Guess I'll have to take the lead and extend an invitation.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fractsidus Artificer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Don't assume you'll always be in control, Changli.

Options.PlotLineKey: Enough talk.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Our friendly chat is over. It's time to say goodbye.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You encounter Xuanmiao, Changli's master, across time. When you touch the old Weiqi board, it glows in response, and you spot the Fractsidus Artificer following you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fractsidus Artificer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Still not giving up yet, Changli?

Dialogues.Speaker: Fractsidus Artificer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We know more than just that unfinished game, we are well aware of the price you have paid... You're dangling at the end of your rope.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fractsidus Artificer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Your unwitting trail has led us straight to our target.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Oh? Is that so?

Dialogues.Speaker: Fractsidus Artificer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Sonoro Sphere is open. Go!

Options.PlotLineKey: Stop them!

Dialogues.Speaker: Fractsidus Artificer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Sorry, but you're not getting past me.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fractsidus Artificer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Jué's formidable time-bending abilities, at their peak... All trapped within this Sonoro Sphere, as I'm sure you are well aware.

Options.PlotLineKey: It's only a legend.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you really want to chase after this legend when you don't even know if it's real?

Dialogues.Speaker: Fractsidus Artificer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: So what? Wouldn't it be a sight to behold as this Sonoro Sphere consumes everything in its path, while the Temporal Disruptions bring death?

Options.PlotLineKey: You're out of your mind...

Dialogues.Speaker: Fractsidus Artificer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway... {PlayerName}, thank you for letting us into this Sonoro Sphere.

Dialogues.Speaker: Fractsidus Artificer
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You are indeed very special, as the Excellency foretold.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: A portal to the Sonoro Sphere opens, and the Fractsidus Artificer rushes through, convinced that the power of the Temporal Mandate lies within. After defeating his minions, you and Changli enter the Sonoro Sphere together.

Chapters.Title: Enter the Sonoro Sphere and reveal the Weiqi Board's secrets

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: An unfamiliar space... No sign of the Fractsidus. Changli's also nowhere to be seen.

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I need to find her quick.

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...No! Don't come any closer!

Chapters.Title: Follow the voice calling for help

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huff... Huff...

Options.PlotLineKey: Are you okay?
You got burned. Let me help you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I-I'm fine! It's my Forte... I'm used to it.

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You... Stay away from me, or you'll get burned.

Options.PlotLineKey: Okay, I won't move. Relax.
You won't burn me. I'm very tough.

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This village was attacked by Tacet Discords. There's nothing left.

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why did you come here? No one but the Exiles are willing to stay here now.

Options.PlotLineKey: You shouldn't be here.
Do you know... Changli?

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you a bad person?

Options.PlotLineKey: ... I'm not, I'm looking for someone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...That's what all bad people say.

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whatever you're looking for... There's nobody here but me and the Tacet Discords.

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Changli... who's that?

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm the only one here besides the Tacet Discords.

Options.PlotLineKey: Why are you here alone?

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...When I'm here, no one's afraid of me, and I won't hurt anyone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Anyway... You should hurry up and leave, it's not safe for you to be here.

Options.PlotLineKey: (She doesn't seem lost in the Sonoro Sphere...)
(She looks just like Changli...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Mirages in a Sonoro Sphere shouldn't be able to hold a conversation like this. Are these... phantoms pulled from Changli's memory, generated by Retroact effect?)

Options.PlotLineKey: (Whatever the case, I can't leave her here alone.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why did you stop talking? Are you lost?

Options.PlotLineKey: Yeah, I'm kind of lost.
Can you help me out of this place?

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I... I can take you somewhere safe. I know a shortcut that leads to a safer village.

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh...

Options.PlotLineKey: (Reach out to her.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Inside, you find a young girl surrounded by Tacet Discords. She uses flames to fend them off but injures herself in the process. She resembles Changli, raising suspicions about their connection. Concerned for her safety, you decide to venture deeper into the Sonoro with her.

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: We'll be safe once we get out of here.

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Hmm... This place seems a bit different from what I remember.

Chapters.Title: Go to a safer location with the little girl
Solve the puzzle with the little girl

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Uh... Was there something like this here before?

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These mechanisms... They need to be unlocked from both sides at once.

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Okay. Let's each handle one side. I'll go over there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's open!

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: These are... The villagers, attacked by Tacet Discords...

Options.PlotLineKey: They have already...

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Why... There weren't any of them here before...

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry. My Forte is strong! I will get rid of them and protect you,

Chapters.Title: Clear the roadblock and continue onward

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Tacet Discords! Watch out!

Chapters.Title: Defeat the TDs in your way

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You... Why did you...

Options.PlotLineKey: Leave the fighting to me. You're injured.
I can't let you fight them alone.

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Okay.

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Don't worry, I won't hold you back...

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm not just any kid! I am strong, you know.

Options.PlotLineKey: I know.

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The village I lived in got destroyed by those scary monsters.

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They hid me in a safe basement... While everyone else died or ran away... No one except me made it out alive.

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: When I came out... No one was there anymore.

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Now, I must get to somewhere safe...

Options.PlotLineKey: It's okay, you're not alone anymore.
Let's go find somewhere safe together.

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Okay...!

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The girl reveals her entire village was destroyed during a TD Outbreak. She only survived because some villagers hid her in a fireproof basement.

Chapters.Title: Find a way to get inside together

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: More Tacet Discords... I'll handle them.

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Okay...

Chapters.Title: Defeat the TDs guarding the ruins
Defeat the TDs guarding the ruins

Dialogues.Speaker: Rover
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is this... The key to that door?

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes... And those Tacet Discords just devoured the frequencies of the guard on door duty…

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ugh...

Options.PlotLineKey: Your hands...
Does it hurt?

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It might look kind of scary, but actually... it doesn't hurt at all.

Options.PlotLineKey: Are you sure?

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Of course. I'm a Resonator too, you know. My Forte is a powerful one. I control fire.

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Nothing's brighter and warmer than the fire... it can burn away the cold and drive away monsters.

Options.PlotLineKey: But the fire could burn yourself too.
But you look very tired...

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: T-That's because I don't know how to properly control it yet...

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: The Resonator who taught me about my "Forte" said if I don't use it properly, I'll die young.

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: They also said a lot of things I couldn't understand... Told me I shouldn't use it too often.

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But... if I don't use my Forte, I'd get eaten by the Tacet Discords, or killed by the bad people...

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What's the point of living a longer life if I can't even survive?

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I want to live. I want to become a strong grown-up.

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I want to have good control of my power, and protect the people who protected me in the past.

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And then... And then I'll make a peaceful and prosperous world for everyone.

Options.PlotLineKey: A peaceful and prosperous world for everyone...
That's a respectable goal.

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Yes. According to the village teacher, that means children will no longer be in danger from monsters. We'll all have enough to eat and stable lives.

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But I've still got lots to learn... so I'll need to find someone really strong, and learn from them.

Options.PlotLineKey: You will find a great mentor.
And you'll become very strong yourself.

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Thank you...

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I want to become as strong as you are...

Options.PlotLineKey: Sure, but promise me...
Promise me you'll take good care of yourself, okay?

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I-I understand... I'll do my best.

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: She confides that despite the toll her abilities take on her life, she uses them frequently to survive. Her dream is to grow up and become someone strong enough to help others. To bring peace to this world, she must find a skilled mentor to guide her.

Chapters.Title: Investigate the mechanisms inside the ruins

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What a strange place... It's supposed to look familiar, but there are so many things I've never seen before...

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This door...

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ... I don't know why, but I keep getting the feeling that I've been here before, it's so weird...

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Let's look around... Maybe we'll find something.

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Whoa...!

Options.PlotLineKey: Did you find something?

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I found some dry rations... They look well-kept, should be still edible!

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: It's a bit frozen... No worries, I can use my fire to heat it up.

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you hungry? I haven't seen you take a single bite...

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You can have these.

Options.PlotLineKey: Thank you. I'm not hungry.
What about you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If you don't eat anything for too long, you won't be able to walk.

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I-I'm not hungry yet...

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: There's a piece of paper... It has turned yellow.

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...When the village was raided, I failed to protect anyone with all my efforts. Now all I'm left with are these old injuries and the rest of my meager life, and some food to spare for anyone who passes by.

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: If I had arrived sooner...

Options.PlotLineKey: It's not your fault.
It's a thing of the past now.

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: ...Okay.

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: What is this all about? I don't understand...

Chapters.Title: Connect the light beams of the mechanism

Dialogues.Speaker: Narrator
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You and the girl encounter a mirage of Changli, while elsewhere, Changli sees multiple reflections of her past self. She ponders over it and resolves to find you at all costs.

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: This is...

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (... A mirage of the past.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (This place... It looks familiar, too.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (These are my memories... recreated inside this Sonoro Sphere.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (As I stepped inside, both Rover and the Fractsidus vanished into thin air. The frequencies are constantly changing, and the flow of time is chaotic, just like it had been on Mt. Firmament...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (A Sonoro Sphere affected by Temporal Disruption… Once someone enters, there's a risk of being stuck inside forever. And if my master had planned all of this...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Did he do this to mislead, to separate, or perhaps...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Speaker_83
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (I should be careful. Whatever the case... I must find {PlayerName} first.)

Chapters.Title: Defeat the TDs in your way

Dialogues.Speaker: Little Girl
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Huff... Hah... I-I can do it...

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (Yes, back then, I didn't know how to control my flames. I could only brute force my way out it, and my body was always covered in burns...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Girl's Mirage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Ma'am, are you okay? There's been a lot more Tacet Discords lately...

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Lady's Mirage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm fine, thank you for driving those monsters away... But honey, these cuts and bruises all over you, some new and some old. They never seem to fully heal...

Dialogues.Speaker: Girl's Mirage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I'm a Resonator. These wounds are nothing.

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Lady's Mirage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: *sigh*... Oh honey. You shouldn't be trapped in this place like we are for the rest of your life.

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Lady's Mirage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You should go to the city. With a powerful Forte like yours, you'll surely find a wonderful future for yourself there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Girl's Mirage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: But ma'am, what about you and the others...

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Lady's Mirage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You go out there and make something of yourself. Make us proud. And when you're ready, come back for us. What do you say, dear?

Dialogues.Speaker: Old Lady's Mirage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: And these... Take these with you on your way there.

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (This place... This is where master once lived in seclusion.)

Dialogues.Speaker: Changli
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: (The spaces are a jumbled mess inside this Sonoro Sphere...)

Dialogues.Speaker: Girl's Mirage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Please... Wait!

Dialogues.Speaker: Xuanmiao's Mirage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My dear, you've come all this way. What do you need from me?

Dialogues.Speaker: Girl's Mirage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I-I am... You gave me some food before, I haven't thanked you yet...

Dialogues.Speaker: Xuanmiao's Mirage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: You misunderstood my intentions. When I sought shelter in your hideout during the rain, I gave you rations as a small token of thanks. No need to be troubled by it, little one.

Dialogues.Speaker: Girl's Mirage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: B-but, you told me... The path to safety lies in embracing fortuitous moments. I didn't understand what you meant by that...

Dialogues.Speaker: Xuanmiao's Mirage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Well now, I only said those words on a mere whim. Never expected you to remember them so clearly...

Dialogues.Speaker: Girl's Mirage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I've heard Master Xuanmiao is a wise hermit guru who helps people. Can you, maybe, take me as your apprentice? I've been searching for you for so long... Please, will you consider it?

Dialogues.Speaker: Girl's Mirage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I want to live, learn to control my power, and become stronger... Or I won't see a peaceful and prosperous world...

Dialogues.Speaker: Xuanmiao's Mirage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you know... What defines a peaceful and prosperous world?

Dialogues.Speaker: Girl's Mirage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I think... I think it means people can take care of themselves and have a place to call home.

Dialogues.Speaker: Girl's Mirage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: I... I'm a Resonator too! I have a strong Forte! Look!

Dialogues.Speaker: Xuanmiao's Mirage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Is this... Flame Manipulation?

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Changli's Mirage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Do you have to go, master?

Dialogues.Speaker: Xuanmiao's Mirage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: My time in this world is up, my child. I have my own destination to head to. I can only accompany you so far on this journey.

Dialogues.Speaker: Young Changli's Mirage
Dialogues.PlotLineKey: Are you going to a dangerous place alone? Why can't I go with you?

Dialogues.Speaker: Xuanmiao's Mirage
